newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Shell to sell Swiss refinery.
newsitem.headline: Shell to sell Swiss refinery.

text.p: Royal Dutch/Shell group said on Tuesday it would offer its refinery at Cressier, Switzerland, for sale.
The company also said it would continue efforts to improve the profitability of its Shell Haven refinery in England and it would evaluate its refinery needs in southeast France.
It is also planning a major rationalisation and upgrade of its lubricants production in France and Germany.

"In line with the experience of other refineries in Europe, this business has been delivering inadequate returns and the group is now pursuing several initiatives to rectify the situation. These initiatives are continuous, but in the light of speculation about Shell's refinery policy, the group wants to clarify the situation," said group managing director Steve Miller in a statement.
Shell currently has 14 refineries in western Europe, of which 11 are fully owned. The group refining capacity is 1.6 million barrels per day, giving a 13 percent market share in western Europe.
